meanings.definition: A white or gray scar on the cornea of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with leucoma after the eye injury.
meanings.sent2: She covered her leucoma with a protective eye patch.
meanings.sent3: The leucoma on his eye made him look like a brave warrior with a battle scar.
meanings.sent4: Her leucoma was a reminder of the past struggles she had overcome.
meanings.sent5: The leucoma on his cornea stood out like a snowflake in winter.

meanings.definition: A white patch or spot on the skin.
meanings.sent1: The baby had a small leucoma on his cheek that looked like a tiny cloud.
meanings.sent2: She applied sunscreen to protect her skin from developing leucomas.
meanings.sent3: The leucoma on her arm was so pale, it almost glowed in the dark.
meanings.sent4: His leucoma was like a hidden treasure map on his back.
meanings.sent5: The leucoma on her skin was as pure as freshly fallen snow.

meanings.definition: A white or grayish discoloration on a plant leaf caused by a fungus.
meanings.sent1: The gardener noticed a leucoma on the rose leaf and treated it immediately.
meanings.sent2: The leucoma on the plant indicated a fungal infection that needed attention.
meanings.sent3: The leucoma on the leaf seemed to shimmer in the sunlight, like a tiny pearl.
meanings.sent4: The leucoma on the plant leaf spread slowly, resembling a growing cloud.
meanings.sent5: The leucoma on the leaf contrasted sharply with the vibrant green of the garden.
